meanings.definition: The act of finding or creating a path.
meanings.sent1: The pathfindings through the forest were challenging but rewarding.
meanings.sent2: We relied on the pathfindings of the experienced hiker to lead us safely.
meanings.sent3: The group's pathfindings led them to a hidden treasure in the woods.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition acted as a compass, guiding her pathfindings in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The map provided crucial guidance for their pathfindings in the unfamiliar terrain.

meanings.definition: The process of exploring or discovering a route.
meanings.sent1: Their pathfindings in the desert revealed ancient ruins buried beneath the sand.
meanings.sent2: The pathfindings of the expedition team paved the way for future explorations.
meanings.sent3: The pathfindings of the lost hiker took them in circles until they found a familiar landmark.
meanings.sent4: The pathfindings of the detective led to the discovery of a hidden underground passage.
meanings.sent5: The pathfindings of the scout troop were crucial in navigating the dense forest.

meanings.definition: The practice of guiding or leading others on a journey.
meanings.sent1: His pathfindings as a tour guide ensured that the group stayed safe and on track.
meanings.sent2: The pathfindings of the experienced captain helped the ship navigate through the storm.
meanings.sent3: The pathfindings of the teacher led the students to a fascinating historical site.
meanings.sent4: Her pathfindings as a mentor inspired many to pursue their dreams with determination.
meanings.sent5: The pathfindings of the park ranger kept visitors from getting lost on the trails.
